title.rendered: Best of North East India Tour

content.rendered:
Best of North East India Tour

Home » India » West Bengal » Darjeeling » Best of North East India Tour

Tour Overview

The hill stations of North East India are undoubtedly enlisted among some of the most preferred and pristine lands around the country where travelers from all across the globe flock. The states of this region in India are inhabited by a handful of population and are reckoned for their rich culture, heritage, art, and the beauty of nature.

North East India tour package of Namaste India Trip covers almost every destination falling en-route ranging from Assam to Sikkim to West Bengal. With this 6 nights and 7 days long North East India Tour Package we provide you world-class facilities with this well-designed package that is inclusive of wonderful and relaxing accommodation, proper commutation, meals, and other special requirements (as per your request).

What else to wait for now? Go and grab this exciting deal and give us an opportunity to be your travel guide or companion and we promise you that you are never going to forget this holiday experience.

Best of North East India Tour Itinerary Package

Day 1 :Arrival at New Jalpaiguri/Bagdogra – Kalimpong (85 Kms / 3 hrs)

Your trip commences with your arrival at New Jalpaiguri, where you are greeted at the Bagdogra International Airport/Railway station by an enthusiastic representative of NamasteIndiaTrip.com who then takes you to Kalimpong. Kalimpong is a petite hill station, well known for housing many established educational institutions. Recently, it has become a popular tourist destination as it has a pleasant climate and an abundance of tourist locations in and around the region.

Kalimpong is home to a wide variety of flora and fauna, and is famous for its flower market, especially their wide array of orchids. A lot of flower nurseries engage in the export of Himalayan grown flower bulbs, tubers, and rhizomes and it is their source of revenue generation for their economy. You will find several beautiful Buddhist monasteries which exhibit their collection of rare Tibetan Buddhist scriptures.

On arrival, we’ll have you check in to your designated hotel. Later on in the day, we take you sight-seeing to the beautiful Dello hill, Science Centre, then we visit the famous Hanuman statue as well as the Durga Mandir. You will be staying overnight at Kalimpong.

Day 2 :Kalimpong

After you are served with a delightful breakfast, we take you for a full day excursion to visit some of the North Bengal’s most beautiful spots. Then we head towards Lava and Rishop, two beautiful hamlets amidst the Himalayas, which are famous for its natural beauty and it offers a splendid view of the Himalayan range on a clear day. We spend another night at Kalimpong.

Day 3 :Kalimpong – Gangtok (85 Km/ 3 hrs)

Your scheduled a heavy breakfast, after which we take you to Gangtok- a bustling, friendly hill station in Sikkim. Once you reach Gangtok, you check in to the hotel. And later we take you outside to see Ganesh Tok and Hanuman Tok, then to Namgyal Institute of Tibetology, and Rumtek Monastery. Then we visit the beautiful Banjhakri Falls and Tashi View Point from where Gangtok offers a magnificent view from top. You stay the night at Gangtok.

Day 4 :Gangtok

Your day begins quite early as we take you on an excursion trip to Tsomgo Lake or Changu Lake which is a very popular glacial lake in East Sikkim. Then we visit the Baba Harbhajan Temple- a temple made and revered by soldiers a former Indian Army officer named Captain Baba Harbhajan Singh who’d died near the Nathu La Pass (a mountain pass in the Himalayas which connects the Indian state of Sikkim with China’s Tibet Autonomous Region. The pass is at 4,310 m (14,140 ft) above sea level, and forms a part of the ancient Silk Road).

Believers of Baba Harbhajan, believe that his saintly soul protects the Indian soldiers in inhospitable conditions. After that, we head to the hotel and spend the night in Gangtok.

Note: Visiting all the places mentioned above, you will be required to get a special permit from the Police through the Tourism department.

Nathu La Pass: Visit Nathu La Pass entirely depend on permits and road conditions. For visiting Nathu La Pass, special permission is required from the Indian Army. Kindly note, that the pass is closed on Mondays & Tuesdays every week and during the winter season.

Day 5 :Gangtok – Darjeeling (130 kms / 4 hours)

After you have had your breakfast, we travel to Darjeeling. On arrival, you will check-in at the respective hotel. The rest of the day is meant for relaxation or you can go for a leisure train ride on the world-famous Toy Train. In the evening, you can stroll around the local market, try their local cuisine and simply enjoy the serenity it has to offer as this will be the last night’s stay at Gangtok.

Day 6 :Darjeeling

Around 3:00 am, you will be woken up as we would be taking you to Tiger Hill to catch a glimpse of a mystical sunrise over the Kanchenjunga (Subject to clear weather conditions). On the way back you can see Ghoom Monastery and Batasia Loop, very famous tourist spots. Later in the day, after your breakfast, we take you to some of the famous spots in Darjeeling such as HMI (Himalayan Mountaineering Institute), Zoological Gardens, and Dhirdham temple, Happy Valley Tea Estate, Lebong Race Course, Tenzing, Gombu Rock, Peace Pagoda, and Japanese temple and ride the ropeway which offers you a unique view to enjoy and photograph. The night will be spent in Darjeeling.

Day 7 :Back to New Jalpaiguri/Bagdogra (100 kms / 4 hours)

Return home with sweet memories. After your last breakfast at the queen of hills, we drive you back to New Jalpaiguri/Bagdogra, here your tour concludes with happy memories as you reach the New Jalpaiguri/Bagdogra Railway station /Airport for the journey to your onward destination.

Price Details

Tour Name Best of North East India Tour
Duration 7 Days / 6 Nights
Destinations Bagdogra - Kalimpong - Darjeeling - Gangtok
Tour Price On Request

Chat with specialist who can help plan your tour!

  • +91-971 1616 316

    Holiday Your Way with Namaste India Trip!

    Filling out the information form provided allows you to receive the best budget-friendly customized itinerary in just a few hours.

    • We assure the privacy of your contact data.

    • This data will only be used by our team to contact you and no other purposes.

    Trip Highlights

    • Tour of the Gangtok city enjoying the old Tibetan culture
    • Lava and Bishop Excursion
    • Rumtek Monastery visit
    • Have a ride in the famous Darjeeling Toy train
    • Visit the best spots in Darjeeling like visit to the Zoological Gardens and Dhirdham Temple, Happy Valley Tea Estate, Lebong Race Course, Tenzing, Gombu Rock, Peace Pagoda, and Japanese temple, and ride the ropeway for a unique view to enjoy and photograph.

    Package Inclusions

    • All car / taxi / cab service
    • Accommodation as per itinerary
    • Meals as per itinerary
    • Driver allowance, parking fees, fuel charges
    • Pick up and drop off service

    Package Exclusions

    • Medical and travel insurance
    • Any expense of personal nature
    • Monument entrance fees
    • Tipping, phone bills, etc.
    • Anything not mentioned in the inclusions section

    FAQs for North East India Package

    Q. Why Is Northeast India Our Country's Most Beautiful Region?

    A. The beautiful northeastern states of India have the most biodiversity, which attracts tourists to Sikkim, like the seven sister states of northeast India, is endowed with magnificent mountains and hills, spectacular rivers, stunning waterfalls, and an abundance of natural attractions to explore.

    Q. Which Season Is The Best Time To Visit Northeast India?

    A. The months of March to June are thought to be the best for visiting the North East. These are beautiful days for exploring the tribes, trails, and teas of this magnificent region. North East India is frequently referred to as a separate kingdom.

    Q. What Is The North East's Traditional Dress?

    A. Women's traditional attire consists of a wrapped around skirt with a sari pallu on top. They have different patterns and colors, but they have nothing to do with social status or occasion style. Men wear a Chadar on top of a dhoti or loin cloth around their waist and up to their ankles.

    Q. What Is The Primary Cuisine Of North-East India?

    A. Jadoh is a Meghalaya rice dish that is a popular Pulao dish in North-Eastern India. The meal is typically made with Ambrosial Rice grown in Meghalaya.

    Q. What Industries Are Associated With The Northeast?

    A. Agriculture, commercial fishing, and the forest products industries all contribute significantly to the Northeast's economy. These industries generate more than $103 billion in economic activity and employ 483,375 people. One of the report's key takeaways is the economic impact beyond the farm gate.
